title: How to write a draft - Quora

response.answer_text: At high speed—as fast as you can, with no regard for spelling, punctuation or grammar and little regard for wording, sentence structure and paragraphing. Don’t let the urge to correct yourself interfere. This is a sprint and any way you can get to your final destination is fine. Your goal: get it all down on paper. Don’t back up, don’t hesitate, don’t constantly correct yourself. Just write. Everything you can think of. Once you have your rough draft on paper, start fixing your mistakes and expanding your ideas. The result will be your first re-write. Now do it again. Re-write your first re-write. If you’ve been industrious and honest with yourself, if yo haven’t let perfectionist impulses sabotage you, you will be ready to start polishing.
